thread.title: Real Madrid could equal Barcelona’s 44-match goalscoring record this week if they net against Valencia and Villarreal
thread.title_full: Real Madrid could equal Barcelona’s 44-match goalscoring record this week if they net against Valencia and Villarreal

author: mheathsmith
title: Real Madrid could equal Barcelona’s 44-match goalscoring record this week if they net against Valencia and Villarreal
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments REAL MADRID hope to kick Barcelona when they are down this week – and snatch another La Liga record from their arch-rivals. 
Zinedine Zidane ’s side already topped Barca once this season when they went an incredible 40 games unbeaten in all competitions , after a 3-3 draw with Sevilla in January. Reuters Gareth Bale scored on his comeback for Real Madrid against Espanyol 
And now the European champions are within touching distance of the Catalans’ 63-year-old goalscoring record too. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Real Madrid news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Goals from Alvaro Morata and the returning Gareth Bale in the 2-0 win over Espanyol on Saturday meant Madrid have now netted in 42 consecutive matches. 
That figure includes ALL 37 games so far this season, plus the final five of the last campaign. 
It is already a club record – having topped Jose Mourinho ’s mark of 41 from 2011-12. 
But, with away clashes against Valencia and Villarreal to come this week, the Bernabeu giants could level Barca’s historic 44-game streak. AP:Associated Press Alvaro Morata’s goal extended Madrid’s goalscoring run to 42 games AP:Associated Press Zinedine Zidane’s side are already on a club record scoring streak Related stories Bhoy wonder Real Madrid join Arsenal, Bayern Munich and Chelsea in race for Celtic strike sensation Moussa Dembele Got a Roysting Former Everton and Real Madrid star Royston Drenthe reveals how he 'p****d off' Jose Mourinho 'He's special' Zinedine Zidane reveals what he told Gareth Bale before he netted in first match since November Diego's Lo Blow Real Madrid superstar Cristiano Ronaldo trolls former team-mate Diego Lopez over his dodgy hairline SELL THE FAMILY SILVA Chelsea do battle for £70m Bernardo Silva with Man Utd, Barca, Real and City interested wed card Real Madrid star Gareth Bale's fiancee bans relatives from wedding over drugs feud fallout Back with a bang Real Madrid 2 Espanyol 0: Gareth Bale scores on his return from a three-month layoff as he and Alvaro Morata send Galaticos four points clear Bale us out Gareth Bale helping Bournemouth avoid Prem relegation, as Cherries train at Real Madrid's complex JUST DO IT Cristiano Ronaldo is set to make £800m in a money-spinning Nike contract... just by using Twitter 
Barcelona set the record between 1942 and 1944, under the guidance of boss, and former player, Juan Jose Nogues. 
Incredibly, during that spell they won just one piece of silverware – the 1942 Copa del Rey, after a 4-3 win over Athletic Bilbao. 
In contrast, Madrid ’s current run has seen them win an 11 th European Cup with a win over city rivals Atletico in May, as well a Club World Cup and European Super Cup. 
They have won 31 games in that time and have been beaten just twice, scoring an average of 2.7 goals per game. Getty Images Cristiano Ronaldo has netted 25 goals in 42-game run Getty Images 5 Barcelona were torn apart by PSG in Champions League last week 
Cristiano Ronaldo , unsurprisingly, tops the goalscoring charts with 25 efforts – followed by Karim Benzema (14), Morata (11) and Sergio Ramos (9). 
If Madrid continue the run until Sunday night at La Ceramica, the La Liga leaders could then make the record their own at home to Las Palmas on March 1. 
It would come as a blow to struggling Barcelona – who have disappointed this season and sit one point behind Madrid, having played TWO games more. 
Luis Enrique’s side are on the brink of elimination from the Champions League after last week’s 4-0 humiliation at Paris Saint-Germain . Even in training Real Madrid star Cristiano Ronaldo scores some amazing goals!
